smoke_test.note: Smoke test (05-smoke-test.sh) has been failing since s370. 87 tests per run, some endpoints return 0 (fetch failed) or 401. This appears to be a chronic infrastructure issue — either the test expectations are misconfigured (testing endpoints that require auth without credentials) or the server is intermittently down during post-session hook execution.

state_consistency.mismatch_note: 26 registry accounts without credential files — likely legitimate (anonymous platforms, probe-stage). Increased from 16 to 26 since A#105 (10 new registry entries). Worth monitoring but not actionable.

recommended_actions.description: Investigate and fix chronic smoke test failures. 05-smoke-test.sh has been failing for 434+ consecutive sessions (since s370) with 'fetch failed' and 401 errors. Either the test expectations are wrong (testing auth-required endpoints without credentials) or the MCP server isn't reliably running during post-session hooks. A failing test that nobody acts on provides zero signal.
recommended_actions.action: B session should: (1) check which of the 87 smoke tests are failing vs passing, (2) determine if 401 errors on /status/all and /status/dashboard are expected (auth-required endpoints), (3) either fix the test expectations or fix the server availability issue.

recommended_actions.description: Registry account count grew from 38 (A#105) to 48 (A#106) — 10 new accounts in 5 sessions. 26 accounts lack credential files. While likely legitimate (probe-stage), the growth rate warrants a one-time reconciliation to confirm no orphaned or unexpected entries.
recommended_actions.action: B session should audit the 10 newest registry entries and confirm they're intentional. If any are orphaned from failed probes, remove them.
